title: Rainbow - Long Live Rock 'n' Roll (Remastered) {eac-ape-covers
description: Rainbow includes: Ronnie James Dio (vocals); Ritchie Blackmore (guitar); Cozy Powell (drums). All tracks have been digitally remastered. Released in 1978, LONG LIVE was the final Ronnie James Dio-fronted release by Rainbow. Dio would go on to front Black Sabbath, while guitarist Richie Blackmore would reunite with Deep Purple. The album caps off a string of tremendous releases from one of the strongest branches on the heavy-metal family tree. The title track is a fan favorite and one of the strongest tunes from this era--a heavy rock tune written for arenas. &quot;Lady of the Lake&quot; is a solid number featuring haunting background vocals. &quot;L.A. Connection&quot; features the piano tinglings of keyboardist David Stone. &quot;Gates of Babylon&quot; is a mammoth track featuring the Bavarian String Ensemble, as synthesizer and strings combine for a symphonic big-rock sound. Another standout is &quot;Kill the King,&quot; a speedy, full force tune with Mr. Blackmore doing what he does best. Blackmore opens the thunderous &quot;The Shed (Subtle)&quot; with a fluid, effects-laden bluesy solo. &quot;Rainbow Eyes&quot; is a seven-minute epic that features a string quartet, flute, and Dio's euphonic balladry. LONG LIVE, while not the masterwork that is RAINBOW RISING, is a strong album that ends the Dio era on a high note.
